text: The Karatal-Japyryk State Nature Reserve is located in Naryn Region of Kyrgyzstan. It was established in 1994 with a purpose of conservation of unique nature complexes, protection of rare and threatened species of flora and fauna of Central Tien-Shan, and maintain regional environmental balance. The reserve currently occupies and consists of 3 areas Song-Kul, Karatal- Achatash, and Chatyr-Kul. The Chatyr-Kul area of the nature reserve is a Ramsar site. ==References== Category:Naryn Region Category:Protected areas of Kyrgyzstan Category:Protected areas established in 1994 Category:1994 establishments in Kyrgyzstan
title: Karatal-Japyryk State Nature Reserve
